meanings.definition: A fee paid in advance to secure services
meanings.sent1: I gave the lawyer a retainer to make sure he would help me.
meanings.sent2: The company required a retainer before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: The retainer I paid felt like a magic spell to guarantee their assistance.
meanings.sent4: The retainer acted as a shield, protecting my access to their expertise.
meanings.sent5: The retainer was like a golden key, unlocking their commitment to assist me.

meanings.definition: A device used to hold something in place
meanings.sent1: The retainer kept the wires neatly organized on the desk.
meanings.sent2: She wore a retainer to maintain the position of her teeth.
meanings.sent3: The retainer held the papers together like a loyal friend.
meanings.sent4: The retainer functioned as a silent guardian, ensuring everything stayed in its place.
meanings.sent5: The retainer was like a sturdy hand, keeping the objects secure and steady.

meanings.definition: A person employed to keep watch over someone or something
meanings.sent1: The security company provided a retainer to monitor the premises.
meanings.sent2: The retainer watched over the valuable artwork in the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The retainer was like a vigilant owl, guarding the treasures with keen eyes.
meanings.sent4: The retainer stood as a loyal sentinel, protecting the property day and night.
meanings.sent5: The retainer was a trustworthy guardian, ensuring the safety of the valuable items.
